title: Inondation (Deluge)
text: The handful of British artists in L'Estampe originale had an entr√©e through Lucien Pissarro (artist Camille's son), who moved from France to England in 1890. For years Charles Ricketts made a living with his wood-engraved illustrations, effected with minute precision. The looming serpent and ritual scene reflect his somewhat awkward attempt at symbolic meaning, which he probably assumed a French audience would like.
description: print was removed from the mount bearing the drystamp of publication
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Edward A. Foster, 1966
